co.cask.cdap.api.macro

Interface MacroEvaluator


  • @Beta
public interface MacroEvaluator
    Macro evaluator helps to provide macro substitution at runtime. MacroEvaluator supports two kinds of macros 1) property lookup 2) macro functions. property lookup: Syntax : ${macro} Description: lookup the key "macro" from properties and return the value for the key, could return null if not found. Example : ${user-name} macro functions: Syntax : ${macroFunction(macro)} Description: call the macroFunction with "macro" as the argument to the function. Example : ${secure(accessKey)} - macro function "secure" is called with argument "accessKey".

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String evaluate(String macroFunction, String... arguments)
      Use the macro function and call the function with provided arguments, function uses the arguments and returns the evaluated response.
      String lookup(String property)
      lookup the property and return the value corresponding to the property.

    • Method Detail

      • lookup

        String lookup(String property)
              throws InvalidMacroException
        lookup the property and return the value corresponding to the property.
        Parameters:
        property - name of the property to lookup
        Returns:
        looked up value, could be null if property is not found
        Throws:
        InvalidMacroException - if property evaluates invalid macro

      • evaluate

        String evaluate(String macroFunction,
              String... arguments)
                throws InvalidMacroException
        Use the macro function and call the function with provided arguments, function uses the arguments and returns the evaluated response.
        Parameters:
        macroFunction - macro function that has to be called
        arguments - arguments that will be passed to the macro function
        Returns:
        value returned by macro function
        Throws:
        InvalidMacroException - if macroFunction is not supported
